definition: to clear up/to tidy up/to pick up/to repair
to pick up/to collate or arrange/ten (banker's anti-fraud numeral)

sentences.english: You must you dorm together before you leave.
sentences.chinese: 你必需先拾掇好宿舍才幹分開。

sentences.english: Two hours before we were supposed to go out, I started getting cleaned up.
sentences.chinese: 在約定時間的兩小時前，我開始拾掇自己。

sentences.english: I spent the afternoon dressing my dogs.
sentences.chinese: 我花了一個下午的時間拾掇我的狗。

sentences.english: You'd better pick up the tools after finishing the work.
sentences.chinese: 完成任務後你最好把這些東西拾掇起來。

sentences.english: And clean neat, do not delay to work.
sentences.chinese: 等拾掇齊整了，還不耽誤下地幹活。

sentences.english: A woman appears from the backyard where she's gardening.
sentences.chinese: 一位正在拾掇花園的婦女從後院走了出來。

sentences.english: It's time to get serious about fixing up your apartment or house!
sentences.chinese: 這是給你的公寓或房子拾掇一下的好時機。

sentences.english: May I do the turn-down service for you now?
sentences.chinese: 現在可以爲您拾掇房間了嗎？

sentences.english: So tidy up their own out of a space, in the possession of your heart come quietly.
sentences.chinese: 於是自己拾掇出一份空間，在心底悄悄地把你藏進來。

definition: to put in order/to tidy up/to pack/to repair/(coll.) to sort sb out/to fix sb
to look after/to tend (one's crops, garden, livestock, pets etc)/to repair
to make oneself presentable/to freshen up
to gather/to rake together/to pile up
erhua variant of 幹活|干活[gan4 huo2]
to push lightly/to flick to one side/to get rid of
to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
